intro: Micromeria dalmatica, commonly known as the Dalmatian micromeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to the Balkan Peninsula, this plant thrives in rocky and calcareous soils. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as slopes and cliffs. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
